intro: Cremanium serrulatum, commonly known as the serrated cremanium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
